title: Lovely shops
text: Plaka is the place to be for shopping in Athens. Many souvenir shops with variable quality souvenirs but overall reasonable quality.

title: Stunning
text: The Acropolis is stunning- go early to avoid the crowds and the heat. Make sure you walk al the way around it and view it in its full glory!

title: Worth the visit
text: Very glad we took the time out to walk around the Parthenon -it is fascinating to see the intricacies and skill that was around BC

title: Good to visit
text: It is worth visiting the museum but have to dodge the tour groups as they stand right in front of all the exhibits making it difficult to read the history and information on them.

title: Fantastic food
text: The food is fantastic and worth it for a nice meal which is a little more expensive. Great wine list and wonderful views.

title: Wonderful hotel in a lovely neighbourhood
text: The hotel is stunning, the rooms are very small however but tastefully decorated. The views of the Acropolis are stunning. Breakfast is wonderful and the restaurant meals are delicious too (but a little more pricey than elsewhere but sort( it for a nice meal). The hotel is located very conveniently for all the major attractions and shopping so if I visit Athens again I will be sure to stay here again.

title: Love,y authentic food
text: Wonderful service, great food at a reasonable price and can watch the world go by. If you want to sit outside then you must book in advance and highly recommend it. The moussaka and the stuffed peppers are lovely.

title: Great value for money
text: The food is fantastic and the trip was great value. The boat was older but still comfortable and took us to beautiful spots where the water was clear and the scenery spectacular. Lovely to have the Greek live music played on the return. Well worth the money!

title: Food is excellent but felt like we were rush d
text: The food is fantastic and service great only thing is that they were packing our table up before we finished our wine. Felt like we were rushed and couldn’t enjoy the relaxed experience

title: Beautiful fishing port
text: Beautiful fishing port with lovely restaurants and bars. Walk through the cute whitewashed buildings on clean streets, enjoy a cocktail or a meal whilst watching the boats in the port.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: Right from arrival the staff are simply fantastic. Nothing is any trouble for them. The rooms are comfortable and clean, the pool area and pool is beautiful, breakfast is awesome and the restaurant serves beautiful food. The only slight negative was that the bed was spongy due to a memory foam type layer on top of the mattress but it wasn’t so uncomfortable to complain. The hotel is about a 20 minute walk into town (we walked in for dinner and got a taxi home-€6) and a 30 minute walk to Kolymbithres beach. When we visit Naoussa again we will be sure to stay here!

title: Lunch with a view
text: Lovely lunch - can choose from Platter to a full menu. Food was gorgeous as was the wine and as for the view - magnificent. Really enjoyed our afternoon here

title: Need to clarify portions required
text:
Went with friends for a light tapas lunch (4 of us)- waitress said order 4 or 5 dishes and we will ensure enough for everyone. We ordered 5 dishes and out they came (food was lovely) what she failed to mention was that in ensuring we had enough food for everyone she was bringing out and charging us for 2 serves of each (so 10 dishes). I think she should have asked us whether we wanted 2 of each - so what was supposed to be a light lunch (as we had dinner out that night too) became a large lunch.

Sure we left feeling full but feeling like we had been duped too which was disappointing

title: Fantastic as always
text: 3rd visit here and can’t sing it’s praises high enough. Service is exceptional starting at the bar for a drink and following on into the restaurant. Food is exquisite- loved it all and is a definite must do when in Clare

title: Lovely coffee
text: Lovely coffee but always very busy- probably could do with extra staff on the weekend. Good choice of breakfast and lunch items too

title: Wonderful wines and venue
text: This is an awesome winery. If it is a nice sunny day go along and pick up some lunch items from the winery - they will put it in a basket- grab a bottle of their beautiful wine and sit outside in their funky but comfortable chairs and enjoy the hospitality for the afternoon. Hosts are fantastic- you feel like you are sat in their front lounge enjoying a glass of wine with them and having a chat. It really is one of my favourite wineries in Clare

title: Awesome bar and atmosphere
text: Great bar - second visit and will be a regular haunt when in Sydney. The atmosphere is fantastic, bartenders great and even if you aren't a whiskey drinker there is plenty to choose from. If you are a whiskey drinker you will be spoilt for choice

title: Ok room but nothing special - served it purpose
text: Room was ok, musty smell and hotel decor was peeling so needed updating. However it served its purpose as a one night stop over on way home. Not near town and little further than thought from airport.

title: Wedding Anniversary meal
text: Had the discovery dinner menu with matching wines. All was beautifully presented and explained in full. The food was lovely as was the wines, only thing to note is you don't know the menu until after the event and so if you don't like certain foods it can detract from how nice the meal is as happened to me with 2 courses not eaten as the main ingredient (Fennel in one and Rhubarb in the other) are not to my taste. That been said it was a wonderful evening.

title: Was somewhat underwhelmed
text: The farm shop was not what I expected. It certainly sells all the produce but I can get that at the local supermarket. Went to have lunch and found the menu extremely limited with only 2 hot dishes which were pastry based and heated up in a microwave

title: The most amazing place
text: Spent our Silver wedding anniversary weekend there and it was sensational. We were upgraded into a premium villa (Valley Two) and it was beautiful. No expense spared, beautifully fitted out with everything you need and more. The view was stunning and it was so serene staying there. We didn't want to leave!!

title: Awesome hotel
text: Great location right in the heart of town. Around the corner from the tram and shopping, great restaurants nearby and very helpful staff. Rooms good but in usual US style not overly large however very comfortable. Would highly recommend staying here

title: Cycle over the bridge
text: Great to cycle over the bridge, very busy as expected but great experience. Has shared cycle and pedestrian lanes in am but splits them in afternoon- beware of speeding cyclists and slow walkers

title: Tacky
text: Fishermans wharf is an iconic tourist site in SF. It disappointed as was tacky, too touristy and for the UK travellers could be likened to Blackpool. I would say go and see it only to say you have been there but don't plan on spending too long there- better places to visit

title: Segway
text: Golden Gate park is a break away from the madness of San Fran city. An easy way to get around and see everything is to take a guided Segway tour, informative and fun

title: Great food
text: Scomas on Sausalito was great. Beautiful food, good service and awesome views. Not cheap but then nothing is in SF but loved it

title: Lovely food in an authentic setting
text: I had the beef tenderloin which was cooked to perfection and my husband has the lamb and it too was delicious. Good value, portions were perfect when you add in the side dish, lovely wine list and very friendly and attentive staff.

title: The place to be for apres ski
text: Certainly the busiest in town for happy hour 4-6pm. Need to get there at 4pm on a weekend if you want a seat. Great atmosphere and ambience

title: Great spot to stay in Mount Buller
text: Nice hotel with everything you need, rooms a little on the small size but to be honest you aren't you in them that much so adequate. Good storage for ski gear. Use of Day spa facilities lovely after a hard day in the slopes. Pizza in he loft bar was delicious. Staff all very helpful would definitely stay again

title: Awesome experience
text: We did the tour on the beach and to be that close to the Seals was fantastic. Guide was very informative and explained the difference between these seals and those near Admirals Arch.

title: Ordinary place
text: Had lunch here. Girl on till couldn't add up, they had no change in till to give back to people and food was ordinary. All deep fried and chicken burger was chopped up Chicken not a burger at all.

title: Great location and comfy beds
text: Lovely hotel in a great location, tram stop outside and we walked pretty much everywhere. Staff very helpful and lovely coffee shop/ breakfast bar attached to lobby. Nice views of the park across the road. Rooms were a little on the small size but very clean and the beds were extremely comfy! Nice balcony which allowed you to sit outside and watch the world go by. Would definitely stay again!

title: Excellent position with excellent food and outstanding service!
text: Couldn't have asked for a better venue, wonderful food and exceptional service. Would go back in a heartbeat!

title: Fantastic value
text:
Stayed in 3 bed apartment in July. Was 5 of us, 2 adults and 3 teenagers. Apartment was fantastic, all facilities could want, close to shops, close to town and the ski bus stopped just down the road. Apartment was clean and comfortable with comfortable beds. Re cost it was one of the less expensive when I did research and so I rate it fantastic value for money. Only thing that could have improved was a second bathroom or toilet but we managed with the one.
Would stay again.

title: Great views
text: Great views of surrounding mountains and town and walk once at top. However a little pricey for what it is. Restaurant looked lovely

title: Awesome skiing
text: Great skiing for all levels. We had 2 hour beginner lessons was great and got the kids 2 x private lessons on snowboard. By day 4 our son was on blue runs, not bad after only 4 days. Would recommend private lessons

title: Great view, service and food variable
text: Looked nice, great views, were greeted cordially. Ordered meals and asked if meals came with veg. Told condescendingly that the meal was as written in menu. Asked again with same reply but even more attitude. So ordered side of vegetables at extra cost as no mention of veg on menu. Meal came out with potato galette and carrot! After same waiter collected dishes, pointed out his error re meal came with veg. He told us that it didn't and we were wrong. Not sure where he was looking but veg was there!! No apology and really bad attitude and arrogance. Won't go again which is a shame as we love Moonta Bay

title: Wouldn't even serve us even though was still in time for lunch
text: Arrived on Friday and checked in to house. Went for lunch and found patio across road. It was 1:45 and sign said open for lunch 12pm to 2pm. Went in and asked for table to be told that no longer serving, we pointed out that it was before 2pm and sign said lunch served until 2pm but to no avail. The waitress checked with chef on our insistence but would not offer us anything. Missed out on 4 meals and bottle of wine and a good review!

title: Best accommodation
text: Spent 3 days there. Herb and Janette greeted us on arrival, gave us great ideas on where to go. Accommodation was fantastic, clean, modern, comfortable, home from one. Couldn't have asked for better. Will definitely be visiting again. Can't wait!!
